06/02/08 ~~~ Food for thought ~~~ The best intelligence test is what we do with our leisure...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

And now, brothers, we want you to know about the grace
that God has given the Macedonian churches...

Out of the most severe trial, their overflowing joy and their
extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity...

For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and
even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

They urgentlly pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in 
this service to the saints...

And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves 
first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will...(2 Cor. 8:1-5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

During Paul's third missionary journey, he had collected money 
for the impoverished believers in Jerusalem. The churches in
Macedonia ~ Philippi ~ Thessalonica, and Berea had given money 
even though they were poor, and they had given sacrificially more 
than Paul had expected. Although they were poor themselves, 
they wanted to help...

The amount we give is not as important as why and how we give.
God does not want us to give grudgingly. Instead, He wants us to
give as these churches did, out of dedication to Christ ~ love for 
fellow believers ~ the joy of helping those in need ~ as well as the 
fact that it was simply the good and right thing to do...

How well does your giving measure up to the standards set by the 
Macedonian churches?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for looking only at the 
things I do not have, but help me to see all the blessings
I have received. Give me a heart of compassion and a love
to share what I have with those in need...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will help you see what is important...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Help us to give not grudgingly, but with cheerful and generous hearts, as You have called us to do. May our giving be a reflection of our devotion to You and our desire to care for those in need. 06/03/08 ~~~ (thoughts to live by ~~~There's no success like failure,
but failure's no success at all...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

(a continuation of our last devotion) Paul says:
I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even
beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

They urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in
the service to the saints...

And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves 
first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will...

So we urged Titus, since he had earlier made a beginning, to
bring also to completion this act of grace on your part...(2 Cor 8:3-6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We should realize that the Kingdom of God spreads through 
believers concern and eagerness to help others. Here we see 
several churches joining to help others beyond their own circle
of friends and their own city...

We should explore ways that we can link up with a ministry outside
our own city, either through our church or through a Christian
organization. By joining with other believers to do God's work we
increase Christian unity and help the kingdom grow...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me not to be so concerned about
myself, and more concerned about the welfare of others. Show
me ways to share the blessing I have received with others less
fortunate. Bless those who are reading this devotion by helping
them to see the needs of others...Amen

Keep looking up, it is the best way to gain true wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

By joining with other believers to do God's work we increase Christian unity and help the kingdom grow.

So we urged Titus, since he had earlier made a beginning, to bring also to completion this act of grace on your part.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing that Your kingdom is advanced through the generosity and compassion of Your people. Just as the churches in Macedonia and Achaia joined together to support the saints in Jerusalem, may we too seek opportunities to link arms with believers beyond our own circles, that we may increase Christian unity and further Your work in the world. Give us open eyes to see the needs around us, and open hands to share the blessings You have entrusted to us. May our giving be a tangible expression of Your love. Amen.

Here, we see several churches joining to help others beyond their own circle of friends and their own city. We should explore ways that we can link up with a ministry outside our own city, either through our church or through a Christian organization. By joining with other believers to do God's work, we increase Christian unity and help the kingdom grow.

06/04/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~Suspenders are the oldest form
of social security...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

(Paul continues) But just as you excel in everything ~ in faith,
in speech, in knowledge, in complete earnestness and in your
love for us ~ see that you also excel in this grace of giving...

I am not commanding you, but I want to test the sincerity of your 
love by comparing it with the earnestness of others...(2 Cor. 8:7, 8) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

By what Paul writes it would seem that the Corinthian believers
excelled in everything ~ they had faith, gifted speakers, knowledge, 
enthusiasm, and love...

But Paul also wanted them to be leaders in giving. Giving is a natural
response of love. We need to remember that Paul did not order the 
Corinthians to give, but he encouraged them to prove that their love was 
real...

When we truly love someone, we should want to give that person
our time and attention and provide for his or her needs. If we
refuse to help, our love is not as genuine as we say...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, thank you for the many blessing I have 
received in my life time. You know that I love You because You
know my heart ~ But those I wish to know my love for them do
not know me as You do~ so please Lord help me to better prove
my love for them...Amen

Keep looking up, love elevates us to a higher calling...
You are in the prayers of two who love you...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

When we truly love someone, we should want to give that person our time and attention and provide for his or her needs. If we refuse to help, our love is not as genuine as we say.

Just as the Corinthian believers excelled in faith, knowledge, and love, may we too be leaders in the grace of giving. Help us to remember that our gifts are a reflection of our love for You and for others. May we give cheerfully and generously, not out of obligation, but out of a sincere desire to serve and bless. Guide us, Lord, to prove the genuineness of our love through our willingness to share. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.

06/05/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Your character is built by what you stand for,
your reputation by what you fall for...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul continues: Here is my advise about what is best for you
in this matter: Last year you were the first not only to give but
also to have the desire to do so...

Now finish the work, so that your eager willingness to do it may
be matched by your completion of it, according to your means...

For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according 
to what it has, not according to what it does not have...

Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard 
pressed, but that there might be equality...(2 Cor. 8:10-13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Christians in the Corinthian church had money, and apparently
they had planned to collect money for the Jerusalem church a year
earlier (see 2 Cor. 9:2)...

Paul challenges them to act on these plans. We should see that
four principles of giving emerge here:

1) Your willingness to give enthusiastically is more important than
the amount you give;
2) You should strive to fulfil your financial commitments;
3) If you give to others in need, they will, in turn, help you when you are in need;
4) You should give as a response to Christ, not for anything you can get out of it.

How you give reflects your devotion to Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always be mindful of 
the needs of others. Temper my heart with grace and
mercy, give me a forgiving heart I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, and your heart will be changed...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

How you give reflects your devotion to Christ.

Help us to be faithful stewards of the resources You have entrusted to us, that we may joyfully give to those in need, not out of compulsion, but as a response to Your love and grace. May our willingness to share reflect our devotion to Christ, that we may be a blessing to others and glorify Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.

06/06/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The worst of my actions and feelings do not seem
to be so offensive as the cowardice of not daring to 
admit them...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Paul surely understood human nature, He says:

"For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according
to what one has, not according to what he does not have...

Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard
pressed, but that there might be equality...(2 Cor. 8:12, 13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul says that we should give of what we have, not what we
don't have. Sacrificial giving must be responsible giving...

Paul wants believers to give generously but not to the extent
that those who depend on the givers (their families for example)
must go without having their basic needs met...

Give until it hurts, but don't give tell it hurts your family and/or
relatives who need your financial support...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a more responsible
giver ~ help me to always remember all that I have is a
gift from you, and was not meant to be used only to please
my own comforts...Amen.

Keep looking up, seek His counsel...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Paul says that we should give of what we have, not what we don't have. Sacrificial giving must be responsible giving. Paul wants believers to give generously but not to the extent that those who depend on the givers (their families for example) must go without having their basic needs met. Give until it hurts, but don't give tell it hurts your family and/or relatives who need your financial support.
original_verse_text: Paul surely understood human nature, He says: "For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what he does not have. Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed, but that there might be equality.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your hand. Teach us to be faithful stewards, giving generously from what we have, not beyond our means. May our sacrificial giving be a reflection of Your love, not a burden that harms those who depend on us. Guide us, Lord, to give with wisdom and compassion, that we may be a blessing to others and bring glory to Your name. Amen.

Paul wants believers to give generously but not to the extent that those who depend on the givers (their families, for example) must go without having their basic needs met. Give until it hurts, but don't give until it hurts your family and/or relatives who need your financial support.

06/07/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ When it is more profitable to talk than to listen,
change your company...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Remember this: whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly,
and whoever sows generously will also reap generously.

Each man should give what he has decided in his heart to give,
not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

And God is able to make all grace abound to you so that in all things 
at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good 
work...(2 Cor. 9:6-8) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

People often hesitate to give generously to God because
they worry about having enough money left over to meet
their own needs...

Paul assured the Corinthians that God was able to meet their
needs...

We need to remember that our attitude is more important
than the amount we give. We don't have to be embarrassed 
if we can give only a small gift...

God is concerned about how we give from the resources we 
have (see Mk. 12:41-44). According to that standard, the
giving of the Macedonian churches would be difficult to match (8:3).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I find myself falling short in so many areas 
of my life when I consider all that You have done for me...Help me
to be more faithful in my walk with You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He may be speaking to You today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

According to that standard, the giving of the Macedonian churches would be difficult to match (8:3).

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your hand. Help us to not be anxious about our own needs, but to trust in Your abundant provision. May we offer our lives as living sacrifices, not conforming to the patterns of this world, but being transformed by the renewing of our minds. Guide us to give joyfully and generously from the resources You have entrusted to us, not out of compulsion, but out of love for You and for others. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

06/09/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~The only way to learn something thoroughly is by 
starting at the bottom, except when learning to swim...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Now He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will
also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the 
harvest of your righteousness...(2 Cor. 9:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God gives us resources to use and invest for Him...

Paul uses the illustration of seed to explain that the resources
God gives us are not to be hidden ~ foolishly devoured ~ or
thrown away...

Instead ~ they should be cultivated in order to produce more
crops...

When we invest what God has given us in His work He will provide
us with even more to give in His service...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the many blessings You 
have provided me with, give me wisdom to use these gifts wisely
to further Your Kingdoms work...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will guide your way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God gives us resources to use and invest for Him. Paul uses the illustration of seed to explain that the resources God gives us are not to be hidden ~ foolishly devoured ~ or thrown away. Instead ~ they should be cultivated in order to produce more crops. When we invest what God has given us in His work He will provide us with even more to give in His service.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your bountiful hand. Help us to be faithful stewards of the resources You entrust to us, not hoarding them selfishly, but sowing them generously in the work of Your kingdom. May we trust in Your promise that as we give freely, You will provide us with even more to share. Use us, Lord, as instruments of Your grace, that our lives may bear abundant fruit for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: God gives us resources to use and invest for Him. Paul uses the illustration of seed to explain that the resources God gives us are not to be hidden, foolishly devoured, or thrown away. Instead, they should be cultivated in order to produce more crops. When we invest what God has given us in His work, He will provide us with even more to give in His service.
subject: Investing God's Resources Wisely

06/10/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ No person really becomes a fool until
they stop asking questions...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of
God's people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks
to God...

Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves, men 
will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession
of the gospel of Christ, and for your generosity in sharing with them
and with everyone else...

And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you, because 
of the surpassing grace God has given you...

Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift...(2 Cor. 9: 12-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul emphasizes the spiritual rewards for those who give
generously to God's work. We should never expect to become 
wealthy through giving...

Those who receive your gifts will be helped, will praise God,
and will pray for you...

As you bless others, you will be blessed...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, remind me to share of the many
blessing I have received from You with those who are not
as fortunate as I have been. I pray for good health and safety 
for each person who will read this message...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will help you give...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

06/11/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ A good listener is not only popular everywhere,
but after awhile they know something...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

For though we live in the world we do not wage war as the world does...

The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. on the
contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds...

We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up
against the knowledge of God and we take captive every thought
to make it obedient to Christ...(2 Cor 10:3-5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We, like Paul, are merely weak humans, but we don't need to use
human plans and methods to win our battles...

God's mighty weapons are available to us as we fight against the 
devils "strongholds." the Christian must choose whose methods to
use ~ God's or the world's...

Paul assures us that God's mighty weapons ~ prayer, faith, hope, 
love, God's Word, the Holy Sprit ~ are powerful and effective
(see Eph. 6:12-18)...

These weapons can break down the proud human arguments
against God and the walls that Satan builds to keep people from 
finding God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the weapons that are 
available to all Christians to break down Satan's barriers to
God. I thank you for that power...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will make available to you 
the power to overcome Satan's attacks...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al and Marcie Sather...

God's mighty weapons are available to us as we fight against the devils "strongholds." the Christian must choose whose methods to use ~ God's or the world's. Paul assures us that God's mighty weapons ~ prayer, faith, hope, love, God's Word, the Holy Sprit ~ are powerful and effective (see Ephesians 6:12-18). These weapons can break down the proud human arguments against God and the walls that Satan builds to keep people from finding God.
original_verse_text: For though we live in the world we do not wage war as the world does. The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. on the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds. We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge our weakness as mere humans, yet we rejoice in the mighty weapons You have provided for our spiritual battles. Help us to rely on Your power, not our own methods, as we fight against the strongholds of the devil. May our prayers, faith, and the truth of Your Word break down the proud arguments that keep people from finding You. Strengthen us with Your Spirit, that we may stand firm against the schemes of the enemy. Amen.
reflection: We, like Paul, are merely weak humans, but we don't need to use human plans and methods to win our battles. God's mighty weapons are available to us as we fight against the devil's strongholds. The Christian must choose whose methods to use—God's or the world's. Paul assures us that God's mighty weapons—prayer, faith, hope, love, God's Word, the Holy Spirit—are powerful and effective (see Ephesians 6:12-18). These weapons can break down the proud human arguments against God and the walls that Satan builds to keep people from finding God.

06/12/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The lessons which are remembered the longest
are those which are taught by example...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you
with my letters...

For some say, 'His letters are weighty and forceful, but in 
person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing.'

Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when
we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present...(2 Cor. 10:9-11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Some were saying that Paul's speaking amounted to nothing.
Greece was known for its eloquent and persuasive orators...

Evidently, some were judging Paul by comparing him to other
speakers they had heard, and perhaps Paul was not the most 
powerful preacher, (but he was an excellent debater).

What we need to remember is that Paul was responding obediently
to God's call and so introduced Christianity to the Roman empire...

If we look to Ex. 4:10-12 and Jer. 1:6 we will see that Moses and 
Jeremiah also had problems speaking...

Preaching ability is not the first prerequisite of a great leader, what
is most important is remaining faithful...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for faithful men like Paul.
Because of them we have Your printed Word today. Help
me to stand firm on Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our Commander and Chief...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

What we need to remember is that Paul was responding obediently to God's call and so introduced Christianity to the Roman empire. If we look to Exodus 4:10-12 and Jeremiah 1:6 we will see that Moses and Jeremiah also had problems speaking. Preaching ability is not the first prerequisite of a great leader, what is most important is remaining faithful.

' Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our abilities and talents are not our own, but gifts from Your hand. Like Moses and Jeremiah, we may feel inadequate in our speech or skills, yet we know that You call us to faithfulness, not perfection. Help us, Lord, to respond obediently to Your divine purpose, trusting that You will provide the words and the power to fulfill Your will. May we never be swayed by the opinions of others, but remain steadfast in our commitment to You. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

06/13/08 ~~~ (Food for thought) ~~~Enthusiasm is contagious, and so is the lack of it...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "Let him who boasts boast in the Lord."

For it is not the one who commends himself who
is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.
(2 Cor. 10:17, 18) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When we do something well, we want to tell others and
be recognized. But recognition is dangerous ~ it can lead
to inflated pride...

It is so much better to seek the praise of God rather than
the praise of people. Then ~ when we receive praise, we
will be free to give God the credit...

What are some things you should change about the way you 
live in order to receive God's commendation?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, if I should receive praise, I pray
that I would not become prideful. For I know that all that
I do is possible only through You. So, help me to always 
give You the credit...Amen.

Keep looking up, our strength comes from above...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

It is so much better to seek the praise of God rather than the praise of people. Then ~ when we receive praise, we will be free to give God the credit. What are some things you should change about the way you live in order to receive God's commendation?

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that any good we do is by Your grace and for Your glory. Help us to resist the temptation of seeking the praise of others, and instead, to seek Your commendation above all else. May we find our joy and satisfaction in pleasing You, not in the recognition of the world. Guide us, Lord, to live in a way that brings honor to Your name, not our own. We give You all the praise and glory. Amen.
reflection: When we do something well, we want to tell others and be recognized. But recognition is dangerous — it can lead to inflated pride. It is so much better to seek the praise of God rather than the praise of people. Then, when we receive praise, we will be free to give God the credit. What are some things you should change about the way you live in order to receive God's commendation?

06/14/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The first and most important step toward
success is the feeling that we can succeed...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says: "I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by
the serpent's cunning, your minds may somehow be led 
astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ...
(2 Cor. 11:3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Corinthians pure and simple devotion to Christ was being
threatened by false teaching. Paul did not want the believers 
to lose their singe-minded love for Christ...

Keeping Christ first in our life can be very difficult when we have
so many distractions threatening to sidetrack our faith. Just as Eve 
lost her focus by listening to the Serpent, we too can lose our focus
by letting our life become overcrowded and confused...

Is there anything that weakens your commitment to keep Christ first
in your life?

What are someways you can minimize the distractions that threaten 
your devotion to Christ???

Keep looking up, keep your focus totally on Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Keeping Christ first in our life can be very difficult when we have so many distractions threatening to sidetrack our faith. Just as Eve lost her focus by listening to the Serpent, we too can lose our focus by letting our life become overcrowded and confused.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to remain steadfast in our devotion to Christ. Help us, Lord, to guard against the deception of false teachings that would seek to sway us from the simplicity and purity of our love for You. Keep our minds focused on the truth of Your Word, that we may not be tossed about by every wind of doctrine, but instead grow up in all aspects into Christ, our Savior. May our love for You be our guiding light, that we may not lose our way amidst the distractions of this world. In Your name we pray, Amen.

06/16/08 ~~~ (Food for thought) ~~~No bird soars too high if it soars with its own wings...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul's says, "I may not be a trained speaker, but I do have knowledge.
We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way...

Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching
the gospel of God to you free of charge...(2 Cor 11:6, 7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Corinthians may have thought that preachers could be judged
by how much money they demanded. A good speaker would charge
a large sum, a fair speaker would be a little cheaper, a poor speaker 
would be free...

The false teacher may have argued that because Paul asked no fee
for his preaching, he must have been an amateur, with little authority
or competence...

Believers today must be careful not to assume that every preacher
or evangelist who is well known or who demands a large honorarium
is superior at teaching God's Word...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the simple clear 
messages, that are easy to understand. I thank you for
Your Word, for it is a lamp onto my feet and a light onto
my path, for without Your Word each day I would stumble
and fall for may of Satan's knifing ways...Amen.

Keep looking up, His salvation is free...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

06/ 17/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Great souls stutter in silence...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul is still speaking about the false preachers that 
the Corinthians were dealing with...

For such men are false apostles. deceitful workmen, 
masquerading as apostles of Christ...

And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as 
an angel of light...

It is not surprising, then, if his servant masquerade as 
servants of righteousness. Their end will be what their 
actions deserve... (2 Cor. 11:13-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Satan and his servants can also deceive us by appearing
to be attractive, good, and moral. Many unexacting people
follow smooth-talking... 

Bible quoting leaders into cults that alienate them from their 
families and lead them into the practice of immorality and 
deceit...

Don't be fooled by external appearances. Our impressions 
alone are not an accurate indicator of who is or isn't a true 
follower of Christ...

SO, it helps to ask questions:
(1) Do the teachings confirm Scriptures (Acts 17:11)?
(2) Does the teacher affirm and proclaim that Christ is 
God who came into the world as a man to save people
from their sins(1 Jn 4:1-3)?
(3) Is the teachers life style consistent with biblical morality
(Mt. 12:33-37)?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for godly wisdom, so that
I would not be lead astray by the fashionable preachers 
of the day. Help me to examine closely what is being 
preached...Amen.

Keep looking up, true wisdom comes from above...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

(2) Does the teacher affirm and proclaim that Christ is God who came into the world as a man to save people from their sins(1 John 4:1-3)? Grant us the wisdom to recognize and reject any teaching that does not affirm the divinity of Christ and the power of His salvation. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk in the light of Your truth. Amen.

06/18/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~All our dreams can come true if 
we have the courage to pursue them...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul was especially concerned for these new churches 
because of the many false teachers, he says:

"besides everything else, I face daily the pressure of my
concern for all the churches...

Who is weak, and I do not feel weak? Who is led into sin,
and I do not inwardly burn? (2 Cor. 11:28, 29) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Not only did Paul face beatings and dangers, he also carried
the daily concern for the young churches. He worried whether
they would stay true to the Good News and free from false
teachings, and inner strife...

Paul was concerned for individuals in the churches he had served.

If God has place you in a position of leadership and authority
treat people with Paul's kind of empathy and concern...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus, Help me remember to keep Your people
in my prayers. Help me to always be faithful in reaching out
to those who need to know You...Amen.

Keep looking up, from where our strength comes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Like the apostle Paul, may we bear the daily burden of concern for Your people, that they may remain steadfast in the truth of Your Gospel. Grant us the wisdom and compassion to guide them, and the courage to confront any false teachings or inner divisions that would threaten their faith. May we always remember that we are servants of Christ, accountable to You for the care of Your flock. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

06/18/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~Charm is a glow within a person that casts
a most becoming light on others...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was 
caught up to the third heaven. Whether it was in the 
body or out of the body I do not know~~God knows.

And I know that this man ~ whether in the body or apart 
from the body I do not know but God knows,

was caught up into paradise. He heard inexpressive things, 
things that man is not permitted to tell...(2 Cor 12:2-4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul continued his "boasting" by telling about visions
and revelations he had received from the Lord, Paul
explained that he didn't know if he was taken up in his
body or in his spirit...

This incident cannot be positively identified with a
recorded event in Paul's career, although some think
this may have been when he was stoned and left for
dead (Acts 14:19, 20).

Our Lesson for Today:

The reason Paul told about this incident was to show
that he had been uniquely touched by God....

Suppose you had, had such an experience could you
explain it any better that Paul?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, I thank You for Paul's experience.
It is not to difficult to imagine that he was speechless because
of the sounds and the beauty of the place that has been
prepared for us. Help us to be prepared for our departure...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has prepared a place for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

06/20/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ Next to good judgement, diamonds and pearls
are the rarest things in the world...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

But He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for My power is made 
perfect in weakness. Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my
weakness, so that Christ's power may rest on me...(2 Cor. 12:9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul prayed that God would remove his affliction, But God did not do
it because He wanted to demonstrate His power through Paul. The 
fact that God's power is displaced in our weakness should give us
courage and hope...

As we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our
effectiveness rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent...

Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deep
our worship, because in admitting them, we affirm God's strength...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercies
which are new every day. I thank You for my e-mail friends and 
I pray that You would bless them with good health and safety...Amen

Keep looking up, God answers prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deep our worship, because in admitting them, we affirm God's strength.

When we are faced with afflictions and struggles, grant us the courage to depend on Your strength rather than our own. May our limitations deepen our worship and draw us closer to You, for it is through Your power that we can do all things. In Your mighty name we pray, Amen.

06/21/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Leave everything a little better than you found it...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul has just said that God would not remove his thorn in the flesh
as he calls it...(Paul says)

That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weakness, in insults, in
hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak,
then am I strong...(2 Cor. 12:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When we are strong in abilities or resources, we are
tempted to do Gods work on our own, and that can 
lead to pride...

When we are weak, allowing God to fill us with His power, 
then we are stronger than we could ever be on our own,,,

God does not intend for us to be weak, passive, or ineffectual,
Life provides enough hindrance and set-backs without us 
creating them...

When those obstacles come we must depend on God. Only
His power will make us effective for him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to turn all
my problems over to you, guide and direct my life I pray...
Amen.

Keep looking up, He is always there for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Help us to embrace the truth that when we are weak, Your power is made perfect in us. Fill us with the strength of Your Spirit, that we may be rooted and grounded in Your love, and be effective in Your service. May we not create unnecessary obstacles, but instead, depend on You in times of difficulty. We trust in Your power to make us strong and fruitful for Your kingdom. Amen.
reflection: When we are strong in abilities or resources, we are tempted to do God's work on our own, and that can lead to pride. When we are weak, allowing God to fill us with His power, then we are stronger than we could ever be on our own. God does not intend for us to be weak, passive, or ineffectual. Life provides enough hindrance and setbacks without us creating them. When those obstacles come, we must depend on God. Only His power will make us effective for Him.
subject: Strength in Weakness: Relying on God's Power
verse_text: Paul has just said that God would not remove his thorn in the flesh as he calls it. (Paul says) That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weakness, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then am I strong.

06/23/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Finding fault is the most common type of unskilled labor...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "I have made a fool of myself, but you drove me to it.
I ought to have been commended by you, for I am not in the least
inferior to the "super-apostles," even though I am nothing...

The things that mark an apostle ~ signs, wonders and miracles ~
were done among you with great perseverance...(2 Cor. 12:11, 12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul was not merely revealing his feelings, he was defending his authority 
as an apostle of Jesus Christ. 

Paul had been hurt by the church of Corinth by their doubting and questioning 
him, so he defended himself for the cause of the "Good News." 

When people question you, do you only think of saving your reputation OR
are you more concerned about what people will think about Christ?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, I pray that my words and actions would
not be an offense to You. I pray that I would always remember
that as a believer I am representing You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the light...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Grant us the courage to defend our faith, not out of a desire to protect our reputation, but out of a deep love for You and a concern for how others perceive the Good News of Jesus Christ. May our lives be a testament to Your power and grace. Amen.

06/23/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Beware of the opportunist ~ they have no use
for people they can't see...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul writes: "I am afraid that when I come I may not find you 
as I want you to be, and you may not find me as you want me
to be. I fear that there may be quarreling, jealousy, outburst 
of anger, factions, slander, gossip, arrogance and disorder...

I am afraid that when I come again my God will humble me 
before you, and I will be grieved over many who have sinned
earlier and have not repented of the impurity, sexual sin and 
debauchery in which they have indulged...(2 Cor. 12:20, 21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

After reading this list of sins, it is hard to believe that these are
the people that Paul said possessed great gifts and excelled
as leaders (8:7)...

Paul feared that the practices of wicked Corinth had invaded the 
congregation. He wrote sternly, hoping that they would straighten 
out their lives before he arrived...

This should be a warning to us who believe, not to let the secular 
society dictate how we are to treat others. We should not let 
culture influence our behavior...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to heed Paul's warning to
stay clear of secular behavior.Forgive me for the sins I 
have committed. Bless each and every e-mail friend today
with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, your path to guide...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

06/25/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Often the voice of conscience has a difficult
time making connections with the ears...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith;
test yourselves. Do you not realize that Christ Jesus is 
in you ~ unless of course, you fail the test? (2 Cor. 13:5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Corinthians were called to examine and test themselves to see
if they were really Christians...

Just as we get physical check ups, Paul urges us to give ourselves
spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing awareness of Christ's
presence and power in our life...

We need this checkup to see if we are true Christians or merely 
impostors. If we are not actively seeking to grow closer to God, 
we are drawing father away from Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to make
an honest examination of my spiritual health. Open my spiritual 
eyes to any sins that I am unaware of...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His guidance...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

Help us to discern the presence and power of Your Holy Spirit within us, that we may be assured of our salvation and grow ever closer to You. May we not be mere impostors, but true followers of Christ, yielding to Your transformative work in our lives. Guide us, Lord, as we strive to walk in the newness of life, empowered by the same Spirit that raised Jesus from the dead. Amen.

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We can not do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.

We are glad whenever we are weak but you are strong; and
our prayer is for your projection...(2 Cor 13:8, 9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Just as parents want their children to grow into mature adults,
so Paul wanted the Corinthians to grow into mature Christians...

As we share the Good News, our goal should be not merely
to see others profess faith or begin attending church but to
see them become mature in their faith...

Don't set your sights too low...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be faithful to share the
Good News ~ so that others will mature in their faith. Bless 
each of my e-mail friends with safety and good health...Amen.

Keep looking up, in faith and love...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

06/27/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ If you really think about it, life is nothing but
an experiment that we are all new at...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Finally, brothers, good-by. Aim for perfection, listen to my
appeal, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love 
and will be with you...(2 Cor. 13:11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul's closing words ~ what he wanted the Corinthians to remember
about the needs facing their church ~ are still fitting for the church today.

When these qualities are not present, there are problems that will have
to be dealt with. These traits do not come to a church by glossing over
problems, conflicts, and difficulties...

They are not produced by neglect, denial, withdrawal, or bitterness. They
are the by-products of the extremely hard work of solving problems...

Just as Paul and the Corinthians had to hammer out difficulties to bring 
peace, so we must apply the principles of God's Word and not just hear 
them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help our church to be of one mind,
help us to live in peace. Help us to be like minded. help
us to scrap all ideas that we can not come to a consensus
about...Amen.

Keep looking up, for Godly wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Help us to put aside our differences and work diligently to solve the problems that arise within Your church. Grant us the strength to pursue peace, to be of one mind, and to live in peace, that Your name may be glorified. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with us all. Amen.

06/28/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Kind words can be short and easy to speak
but their echoes are truly endless...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

Who gave Himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil age,
according to the will of our God and Father,

to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen...(Gal. 1:3-5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God's plan all along was to save us by Jesus' death...

We have been rescued from the power of this present world
a world ruled by Satan and full of cruelty, tragedy, temptation, 
and deception...

Being rescued from this evil world doesn't mean that we are 
taken out it but that we are no longer enslaved to it. You were
saved to live for God...

Does your life reflect your gratitude for being rescued? Have
you transformed your loyalty from this world to Christ???

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You again today for taking my place
upon the cross. I pray that my life reflects my
gratitude for saving my life Amen...

Keep looking up, in gratitude for what Christ 
has done in your life ...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Lord, may our lives reflect our deep gratitude for this great redemption. Transform our minds, that we may discern Your perfect will and live as faithful servants in this present age. To You be the glory forever and ever. Amen.

06/30/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Beware of false doctrine

Our Bible verse for today:

I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one 
who called you by the grace of Christ and are turning to a
different gospel...(Gal 1:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Some people were preaching "a different way." They were
teaching that to be saved, Gentile believers had to follow
Jewish laws and customs, especially the rite of circumcision...

They were preaching that faith in Christ was not enough. This
message undermined the truth that salvation is a gift, not a reward
for certain deeds. Jesus Christ has made this gift available to all
people...

Beware of people who say that we need more than simple faith in 
Christ to be saved. When people set up additional requirements 
for salvation, they deny the power of Christ's death on the cross
(see Gal. 3:1-5).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for the gift of salvation that is ours
through faith in the finished work of Christ on the cross.
Make this clear to all who read this today...Amen.

Keep looking up, God has a blessing for you today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Beware of people who say that we need more than simple faith in Christ to be saved. When people set up additional requirements for salvation, they deny the power of Christ's death on the cross (see Galatians 3:1-5).

We lament the ways in which some have sought to add to the simplicity of this truth, undermining the power of the cross. Lord, help us to cling steadfastly to the truth that we are all sinners in need of Your grace, and that it is through Christ alone that we are justified. May we never stray from the gospel message, but boldly proclaim the sufficiency of Your Son's sacrifice. In Jesus' name, Amen.

07/01/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The way of the world is the way of perdition...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Evidently some people are throwing you into confusion and 
are trying to pervert the Gospel of Christ...(Gal. 1:7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Bible says there is only one way to be forgiven of sin ~
which is by believing in Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior...

No other person or method, or ritual can give eternal life. 

Attempting to be open minded and tolerant, some people 
assert that all religions are equally valid paths to God. In a
free society, people have the right to their opinions, but this 
does not guarantee that their ideas are right...

God does not accept man-made religions as a substitute for
faith in Jesus Christ. He has provided just one way ~ 
Jesus Christ (Jn. 14:6)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for the sure way to inherit eternal life.
I pray that One Day soon all will come to know the truth...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the only Way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Grand-pa Al & Grand-ma Marcie

May our lives reflect our unwavering trust in You, the one true God. In Jesus' name, Amen.
